items.text: Best ba chor mee ever! ;) Been here like everyweek. Woooohoo. 
The Meesua version is very chewy!
Hill Street Tai Hwa Pork Noodle was awarded One Michelin Star in The Michelin Guide Singapore 2016. A first for street food! A first for Bak Chor Mee!
Maybe I'm not fan of this food but it was just ok,not special for receiving Michelin star
Pork liver isn't my thing. But they made me like it here!
From the pillar where the queue turns into the coffeeshop, it'll be at least 45 mins, depending on how many bowls each person in front is ordering.
BreadTalk's boss George loves this BCM!
This is the BEST ba chor mee I have ever eaten. And I have been saying this for the past 15 years & have recommended this to all who will listen :))
The is very good to eating
Meat ball soup is good too!
한국인입맛에는 안맞을 돼지비린맛. 일찍가도 몇시간기다려야함.
CLOSED on the FIRST and THIRD Mondays of the month.
Very nice to eat
Nice meat ball soup
Prices have increased. Now at $5, $6, $8 and $10.
Awesome Bak Chor Mee!
Only $6 with extra vinegar and lard will completely satisfy you
Dry version mee kia minced noodles.good taste
queued for 90mins. soup: rich flavor of pork meat/bones. pork balls are slightly more tender than regular BCM vendors. extravagant with ingredients, dried fish, plenty mince meat. worth the wait? no.
The best bak chor mee in Singapore....better believe it
Pork noodles (bak chor mee)
A great way to queue here is to do it with your friend and order a beer from the drink stall right next to it. Have a beer and chat with your friend while waiting!
not bad, for those who love lots of vinegar! the big bowls have extra wanton and seaweed soup.
3pm is the best time to eat here to avoid looooooong queue :) best bar chor mee so far 😋
The noodles $5/bowl are delicious and perfectly balanced, but be prepared to queue and stink afterwards!
I like this place
Noodles & ingredients remain sumptuous and well-cooked. But flavour now pales if compared to pre-Michelin era. Still my favourite, but sincerely hope  they bring their magic back to the flavour
Definitely a very flavourful bowl of BCM but not worth the 1hr queue at 10.30am. If u find 10 pax queuing in front of u, estimate an hour wait. Don't come hungry! I will stick to Tai Hwa at Hong Lim.
The BEST mince meat noodle in Singapore.... The one n only store..... MUST try!!!! 
Stall opens @ 9.30am but ppl start getting queue number since br 9am. I came @ 9.30sharp n ended up waiting for 30min for them to clear the "pre-queue" ppl.
The Rojak is a must have while waiting for the queue....
The cook ah Ching is my friend, tasty and delicious noodle. Die die must try.....
First street food stall to earn a michelin star, together with Hong Kong Soya Sauce chicken stall at chinatown
Not bad not bad...can try can try...
Huge line. And the taste was really uneatable for 3 different dishes . Be careful. Not good clean.
Long Q at e Ba Chor Mee stall!
kway teow soup! :)
Minced pork noodles
Is this the same guys from Bestway Building?
Yes!! Today got no loooooong Q..
First time having the dry pork noodle. Very nice noodle. Not those yucky sticky yellowish type. This one has no alkaline after-taste. The execution is refine, not crude pieces of meat etc...NAISE!
The noodles of course!
Ridiculous queue (about an hour) but the best bak chor mee ever.
Arguably one of the best pork noodles you'll find in Singapore: bring a group along, for the queue is rather loooong
Personally the best bak chor mee kia with vinegar for me in Singapore... Queues are always ridiculous so best to come aft 2pm. Sometimes closed on Mondays.
Close every first and third Monday of every month. Min order $5 now, must request for pork lard. It taste even better.
Super nice.. but the queue is the killer!!!
Everything is good here

Hands down the best plate I've tried on Singapore. You need to wait for a 1 hour line but totally worth that pork broth with all the toppings and noodles, vinegar&spicy flavor. Best pork dish in town!
Nice western food. Very  Worth the price (:
The soup is heavenly ! Expensive though
The bak chor mee and western food here is good :)
Best bcm in sg IMO!
They only start at 9.30am but if you get here early, take a query number first.
It is super good!! Must try 😋😋😋
Super slow uncle. No wonder long queue. Prepare to queue for an hour during lunch!
One of the best Minced Meat Noodle in Singapore, but the queue is really quite long.
Not cheap & long queue, but worth waiting coz every single component in my dry pork noodle, incldg the soup was cooked to perfection
Best la. The food and the queue. Western food and Xiao long Bao neighbours are not bad too.
Price is now from $5 onwards
It wasn't worth the wait.
Under renovation.
The noodles & western food are my favorites! Must try!!
Simply the best Bak Chor Mee in Singapore, period.
Best to come after 0930 which is the opening hour. Else owner show you attitude and ask you wait outside the coffee shop.
Happy chef is a must try.
One of the best Bak Chor Mees in the city. You can ask for more vinegar and more chili. I prefer mine with mee kia but some prefer mee pok or the flat noodles.
Come in the afternoon - soup tastes better, less diluted than in evening. Love both dry and soup versions. Extra vinegar and chili please!
Undoubtedly the best Bak Chor Mee that you can find anywhere, ever! Every ingredient is made to virtual perfection, combined all in a well-sized bowl to mix (secret: the home-made vinegar!) 😋
Bak chor mee....awesome!!
Open 9.30 am, for those who like early lunches.
Try the western food! Also nice :D
Ridiculously long Q - it's becos of the uncle. Too slow mo :/
Must come here to eat and expect to be queuing at least 15 to 30 mins....
The q is long, but not on raining day. My first been there, it was very hot, and the uncle was sweating... Meat ball soup is nice too
他妈的！cook a bowl of mee took more den 5min, no wonder so long queue!!
Price increase to min $5.
Definately one of the best ba chor mee in sg. Be prepared for a queue
probably the best ba char mee i have tasted
Super long queue even at 2.30pm
Absolutely got to try Singapore best bak Chor Mee. Mee Kia dry.
Almost the best best bak chor mee, but the wait is just not worth it.
Add $1 for extra pieces of fresh pork liver cooked to perfection - your iron intake source.
before opening u take a # instd of queuing
Damn nice!!!!!!!!!!
Worth the long queue! =)
Still the best ! Go for $10 for big portion. So your queuing time is worth it !
Yup nice BCM but the queue is ridiculous. I would never queue for this again.
Be here before 730pm, otherwise be prepared to be ask to leave the queue.
Must try for the authentic taste of Singapore's Bah Chor Mee! <3 Yum!
Too many people, long queue
You have to be prepared to wait. The queue is always so long!
肉脞面，超赞的！
Meepok dry with xtra chilli. You cant go wrong
Best minced meat noodles (dry) in Singapore. Also awarded by Michelin star. Get ready for 1 hour waiting in a queue...
Be prepared for a long long queue! And it moves ultra slowly.
The soup and minced pork. Noodles with right amount of chilli taste nice:-)
Delicious!! Love the vinegar with the noodles. Will sure drop by again to eat.
The rojak is a must order!
The q here is never ending. Pay for the good bar chor mee. Thu
メニューがありません。肉か魚かとスープの有り無し、量が選べます。
Dry and soup versions are equally good
Tai Hwa Bak Chor Mee... The best that I've tasted so far. Get the 'Big' option, and you'll get a generous serving of the gorgeous soup.
Come earlier on a Sunday to take a queue number.. waiting time in the morning is abt 1.5hrs.
The oldest establishment in noodles as far as anyone can remember. You've made it here, might as well get the largest bowl at 10$.
Singapore best bak chor mee. Try the dry noodle with additional vinegar.
Note that prices have rose to $5, $6, $8 and $10. But queue is just as long....
The meat ball is nice too
